content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 517.10 - Referral of patient for admission to a state-operated psychiatric center

State Regulations
(a) Referral
process. No person under 21 years of age who is a recipient of medical
assistance shall be referred for admission to a State-operated psychiatric
center unless the referring entity shall first have certified, pursuant to this
section, the patient's need for inpatient treatment. Such certification shall
be made on forms approved by the Office of Mental Health. (b) Content of certification. The
certification of need, completed by the referring entity, shall include a
written attestation of the following: (1)
ambulatory care resources available in the community do not meet the treatment
needs of the patient; (2)
proper
treatment of the patient's psychiatric condition requires services on an
inpatient basis under the direction of a physician; and
(3)
inpatient treatment can reasonably be
expected to improve the patient's condition or prevent further regression so
that the services will no longer be needed. (c) Who may complete the certification of
need form. The certification of need form shall be completed by a team of two
or more individuals who are independent of the Office of Mental Health. Such
team, which has knowledge of the individual's situation, and has competence in
the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness, preferably in child psychiatry, shall include a physician. (d) Exceptions to the process for referral. (1)

An expedited referral of a patient to a State-operated psychiatric center may
be completed when services are necessary to prevent serious impairment or
deterioration of the health of a patient, or to prevent immediate serious
physical harm to the patient or others. Such expedited referrals do not require
the completion of a certification of need form by the referring entity. In such
cases, the State-operated psychiatric center shall complete the certification
of need form within 14 days after the patient's admission. (2)

Referring entities which do not have
access to a team as described in subdivision (c) of this section may request
that the commissioner or his designee grant an exemption from the provisions of
this section. (e) Admission criteria. Nothing in this section shall alter a State-operated
psychiatric center's authority regarding the admission of patients to such
facilities. No patient referred by a referring entity shall be admitted to a

State-operated psychiatric center unless the patient meets the admission
criteria of the State-operated psychiatric center. Notes
